title: Bi-directional Answer-to-Answer Co-attention for Short Answer Grading using Deep Learning
authors:
Eshetu, Abebawu  and
Teshome, Getenesh  and
Alemahu, Ribka
venue: Proceedings of the Fourth Widening Natural Language Processing Workshop
abstract: So far different research works have been conducted to achieve short answer questions. Hence, due to the advancement of artificial intelligence and adaptability of deep learning models, we introduced a new model to score short answer subjective questions. Using bi-directional answer to answer co-attention, we have demonstrated the extent to which each words and sentences features of student answer detected by the model and shown prom-ising result on both Kaggle and Mohlerâ€™s dataset. The experiment on Amharic short an-swer dataset prepared for this research work also shows promising result that can be used as baseline for subsequent works.
